triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the core subject of the survey, fundamental to understanding UAV swarms.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics principles and frameworks are fundamental to UAV swarm coordination.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning algorithms are essential for UAV swarm path planning and trajectory optimization.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Navigation techniques enable UAVs to determine positions and plan routes autonomously.

triples.name: Simultaneous localization and mapping
triples.relevance: SLAM is critical for UAV localization and environmental mapping in swarms.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents form the basis for individual UAV autonomy within a swarm system.

triples.name: Wireless network
triples.relevance: Wireless communication networks enable inter-UAV coordination and swarm communication.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems theory provides the foundation for UAV swarm coordination mechanisms.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: Swarm intelligence algorithms drive decentralized decision-making and emergent behavior in UAV swarms.
